sen.j: 建国記念の日（けんこくきねんのひ）とは、日本の国民の祝日の1日である。
sen.e: National Foundation Day is a national holiday in Japan.
National Foundation Day is a national holiday in Japan.
National Foundation Day is a national holiday in Japan.

sen.j: 日付は2月11日。
sen.e: Its date is February 11
Its date is February 11.
Its date is February 11.

sen.j: かつての紀元節。
sen.e: It used to be Kigensetsu (the day commemorating the ascension to the throne of the first emperor, Jimmu).
It used to be Kigensetsu (the day commemorating the ascension to the throne of the first emperor, Jimmu).
It used to be Kigensetsu (the day commemorating the ascension to the throne of the first emperor, Jimmu).

sen.j: 『日本書紀』にある神武天皇が即位したとされる日（辛酉年春正月、庚辰朔）に由来している。
sen.e: It is originated from the day on which Emperor Jimmu is believed to have ascended to the throne (New year's day of the 58th year of the sexagenary cycle, first day of Kanoetatsu) based on "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

It is originated from the day on which the Emperor Jimmu is believed to have ascended to the throne (New year's day of the 58th year of the sexagenary cycle, first day of Kanoetatsu) based on "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

It is originated from the day on which the Emperor Jimmu is believed to have ascended to the throne (New year's day of the 58th year of the sexagenary cycle, first day of Kanoetatsu) based on "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: この日付をグレゴリオ暦に当てはめると紀元前660年（B.C.660年）2月11日となる。
sen.e: It fall on February 11, 660B.C. under the Gregorian calendar.
It falls on February 11, 660B.C. under the Gregorian calendar.
It falls on February 11, 660B.C. under the Gregorian calendar.

tit.cmt: 他のファイルと表現を統一

sen.j: 国民の祝日に関する法律（祝日法）第2条では、「建国記念の日」の趣旨を「建国をしのび、国を愛する心を養う」と規定している。
sen.e: The Article 2 of the law concerning national Holidays (National Holiday Law) prescribes that the aim of "National Foundation Day" is to "reflect on the establishment of the nation and to nourish a love for the country.

The Article 2 of the law concerning national holidays (National Holiday Law) prescribes that the aim of "National Foundation Day" is to "reflect on the establishment of the nation and to nourish a love for the country.

The Article 2 of the law concerning national holidays (National Holiday Law) prescribes that the aim of "National Foundation Day" is to "reflect on the establishment of the nation and to nourish a love for the country.

sen.j: 1966年（昭和41年）の祝日法改正により国民の祝日に加えられた。
sen.e: In 1966, with revisions to the National Holiday Laws, the National Foundation Day was added to national holidays.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1966, with revisions to the National Holiday Laws, the National Foundation Day was added to national holidays.
In 1966, with revisions to the National Holiday Laws, the National Foundation Day was added to national holidays.

sen.j: 翌1967年（昭和42年）2月11日から適用された。
sen.e: The application of the law started on February 11, 1967.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The application of the law started on February 11, 1967.
The application of the law started on February 11, 1967.

sen.j: 他の祝日が祝日法に日付を定めているのに対し、建国記念の日は「政令で定める日」と定めている。
sen.e: The National Holiday law prescribes that the date of the National Foundation Day be designated by a government ordinance, although the dates of other national holidays are designated by the law.
The National Holiday law prescribes that the date of the National Foundation Day be designated by a government ordinance, although the dates of other national holidays are designated by the law.
The National Holiday law prescribes that the date of the National Foundation Day be designated by a government ordinance, although the dates of other national holidays are designated by the law.

sen.j: この規定に基づき、内閣 (日本)は建国記念の日となる日を定める政令（昭和41年政令第376号）を定めた。
sen.e: Based on this stipulation, the cabinet (Japan) enacted an ordinance (1966 Ordinance No. 376) to establish the day for commemorating the National Foundation Day..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Based on this stipulation, the cabinet (Japan) enacted an ordinance (Ordinance No. 376, 1996) to establish the day for commemorating the National Foundation Day.
sen.cmt: かっこ内の順番を変更
sen.e: Based on this stipulation, the cabinet (Japan) enacted an ordinance (Ordinance No. 376, 1996) to establish the day for commemorating the National Foundation Day.

sen.j: 政令により、「建国記念の日は、二月十一日」とした。
sen.e: The ordinance stipulate that "February 11 be National Foundation Day."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The ordinance stipulates that "February 11 be National Foundation Day."
The ordinance stipulates that "February 11 be National Foundation Day."

sen.j: 当日は、全国の神社仏閣で「建国祭」などの祭りが執り行われる。
sen.e: Shrines and temples hold "National Foundation Festivals" all over Japan on this day.
Shrines and temples hold "National Foundation Festivals" all over Japan on this day.
Shrines and temples hold "National Foundation Festivals" all over Japan on this day.

sen.j: 「建国記念の日」と定められた2月11日は、かつて紀元節という祝日であった。
sen.e: February 11 designated as "National Foundation Day" was once a holiday named Kigensetsu.
February 11 designated as "National Foundation Day" was once a holiday named Kigensetsu.
February 11 designated as "National Foundation Day" was once a holiday named Kigensetsu.

sen.j: 紀元節は、『日本書紀』が伝える神武天皇が即位した日に基づき、紀元の始まりを祝う祝日として、1872年（明治5年）に制定された。
sen.e: Kigensetsu was established in 1872 as a day for cerebrating the founding of Japan based on the day on which "Chronicles of Japan" says. the Emperor Jimmu ascended to the throne.
Kigensetsu was established in 1872 as a day for cerebrating the founding of Japan based on the day on which "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) says the Emperor Jimmu ascended to the throne.
Kigensetsu was established in 1872 as a day for cerebrating the founding of Japan based on the day on which "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) says the Emperor Jimmu ascended to the throne.

sen.j: この紀元節は、1948年（昭和23年）に制定された「祝日に関する法律」附則2項で、「休日ニ關スル件」（昭和2年勅令第25号）が廃止されたことに伴い、廃止された。
sen.e: This Kigensetsu was abolished, with the abolishment of "matters related to national holidays" (1927 imperial edict No. 25) under Article 2 of the supplementary provisions of "the law of Holidays of People" enacted in 1948.

This Kigensetsu was abolished, with the abolishment of "matters related to national holidays" (imperial edict No. 25, 1927) under Article 2 of the supplementary provisions of "the law of Holidays of People" enacted in 1948.
sen.cmt: かっこ内の順番を変更
sen.e: This Kigensetsu was abolished, with the abolishment of "matters related to national holidays" (imperial edict No. 25, 1927) under Article 2 of the supplementary provisions of "the law of Holidays of People" enacted in 1948.

sen.j: 紀元節復活に向けた動きは、1951年（昭和26年）頃から見られた。
sen.e: The movements for the revival of Kigensetsu became active around 1951.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The movements for the revival of Kigensetsu became active around 1951.
The movements for the revival of Kigensetsu became active around 1951.

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年）2月13日には、自由民主党 (日本)の衆議院国会議員らによる議員立法として「建国記念日」制定に関する法案が提出された。
sen.e: Legislators of the house of Councilors and members of the Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) submitted a bill as legislation by House members to call for the establishment of "National Foundation Day" on February 13, 1957.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Legislators of the house of Councilors and members of the Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) submitted a bill as legislation by House members to call for the establishment of "National Foundation Day" (建国記念日) on February 13, 1957.
sen.cmt: スペース削除後で「の」に関する説明があるので漢字表記を追加
sen.e: Legislators of the house of Councilors and members of the Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) submitted a bill as legislation by House members to call for the establishment of "National Foundation Day" (建国記念日) on February 13, 1957.

sen.j: しかし、当時野党第一党の日本社会党が「建国記念日」の制定を「戦前回帰、保守反動の最たるもの」として非難・反対したため、成立しなかった。
sen.e: However, such bills did not pass, because the then leading opposition party, Japan Socialist Party, opposed to and criticized the establishment of National Foundation Day, citing "a return to a prewar period and the prime example of reactionary conservatism" as the reason.

However, such bills did not pass, because the then leading opposition party, Japan Socialist Party, opposed to and criticized the establishment of National Foundation Day, citing "a return to a prewar period and the prime example of reactionary conservatism" as the reason.

However, such bills did not pass, because the then leading opposition party, Japan Socialist Party, opposed to and criticized the establishment of National Foundation Day, citing "a return to a prewar period and the prime example of reactionary conservatism" as the reason.

sen.j: その後、9回の法案提出と廃案を経る。
sen.e: Such bills were submitted 9 times but fell through.
Such bills were submitted nine times but fell through.
Such bills were submitted nine times but fell through.

sen.j: 結局、名称に「の」を挿入した「建国記念の日」とすることで、“建国されたという事象そのものを記念する日”であるとも解釈できるように修正し、社会党も妥協。
sen.e: At last Japan Socialist Party compromised with a revised bill, in which "No" was inserted into the name of the day to allow an interpretation of "cerebrating the foundation of a nation itself."

At last Japan Socialist Party compromised with a revised bill, in which the possessive particle "の" was inserted into the name of the day to allow an interpretation of "cerebrating the foundation of a nation itself."
sen.cmt: "No"だと英語のNoに見えてしまうので変更
sen.e: At last Japan Socialist Party compromised with a revised bill, in which the possessive particle "の" was inserted into the name of the day to allow an interpretation of "cerebrating the foundation of a nation itself."

sen.j: 1966年（昭和41年）6月25日、「建国記念の日」を定める祝日法改正案は成立した。
sen.e: On June 25, 1966 the revision of the National Holiday Law was enacted to establish "National Foundation Day."
On June 25, 1966 the revision of the National Holiday Law was enacted to establish "National Foundation Day" (建国記念の日).
sen.cmt: 「の」に関する説明があるので漢字表記を追加
sen.e: On June 25, 1966 the revision of the National Holiday Law was enacted to establish "National Foundation Day" (建国記念の日).

sen.j: 同改正法では、「建国記念の日 政令で定める日 建国をしのび、国を愛する心を養う。」と定めた。
sen.e: The revision states, "National Foundation Day is designated by a government ordinance to reflect on the establishment of the nation and nourish a love for the country.
sen.cmt: 下のセルの」と定め、を、「と定めた」として和文を終了させました。
sen.e: The revision states, "National Foundation Day is designated by a government ordinance to reflect on the establishment of the nation and nourish a love for the country.
The revision states, "National Foundation Day is designated by a government ordinance to reflect on the establishment of the nation and nourish a love for the country.

sen.j: 同附則3項は「内閣総理大臣は、改正後の第2条に規定する建国記念の日となる日を定める政令の制定の立案をしようとするときは、建国記念日審議会に諮問し、その答申を尊重しなければならない。」と定めた。
sen.e: Article 3 of its supplementary provision also states, "Prime minister shall consult Council for National Foundation Day and respect its report when planning to establish an ordinance to designate the date of National Foundation Day as stipulated in Article 2 of the revised National Holiday Law."
sen.cmt: 下の文を合わせ一文にしてあります。
sen.e: Article 3 of its supplementary provision also states, "Prime minister shall consult Council for National Foundation Day and respect its report when planning to establish an ordinance to designate the date of National Foundation Day as stipulated in Article 2 of the revised National Holiday Law."

Article 3 of its supplementary provision also states, "Prime minister shall consult Council for National Foundation Day and respect its report when planning to establish an ordinance to designate the date of National Foundation Day as stipulated in Article 2 of the revised National Holiday Law."

sen.j: 建国記念日審議会は、学識経験者等からなり、総理府に設置された。
sen.e: The Council for National Foundation Day consisting of experienced academics was established in the Prime Minister's Office.
The Council for National Foundation Day consisting of experienced academics was established in the Prime Minister's Office.
The Council for National Foundation Day consisting of experienced academics was established in the Prime Minister's Office.

sen.j: 約半年の審議を経て、委員9人中7人の賛成を得た。
sen.e: After about 6 months of discussions, seven out of nine members approved the day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After about 6 months of discussions, seven out of nine members approved the day.
After about 6 months of discussions, seven out of nine members approved the day.

sen.j: 「建国記念の日」の日付を「2月11日」とする答申が同年12月9日に提出された。
sen.e: A report was submitted in which "February 11" is the day of "National Foundation Day".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A report was submitted in which "February 11" is the day of "National Foundation Day".
A report was submitted in which "February 11" is the day of "National Foundation Day".

sen.j: 同日、「建国記念の日は、二月十一日とする。」とした「建国記念の日となる日を定める政令」（昭和41年政令第376号）を公布、即日施行した。
sen.e: On the same day,"an ordinance to establish the date for National Foundation Day" (1966 Ordinance No. 376) was promulgated in which "February 21 was designated as National Foundation Day"
sen.cmt: 下の文を合わせ一文にしてあります。
sen.e: On the same day,"an ordinance to establish the date for National Foundation Day" (Ordinance No. 376, 1996) was promulgated in which "February 11 was designated as National Foundation Day"
On the same day,"an ordinance to establish the date for National Foundation Day" (Ordinance No. 376, 1996) was promulgated in which "February 11 was designated as National Foundation Day"

sen.j: 総理府の附属機関として1966年7月11日発足、同年12月15日限り廃止（委員定数10人以内）
sen.e: The Council for National Foundation Day, an affiliate organization of the Prime Minister's Office was established on July 11, 1966 and abolished on December 15 of the same year.

sen.e: The Council for National Foundation Day, an affiliate organization of the Prime Minister's Office was established on July 11, 1966 and abolished on December 15 of the same year.

sen.j: 同年7月28日から12月8日まで計9回の会議を開催し、12月9日付けで内閣総理大臣宛て「二月十一日」とする答申（個別意見付記）
sen.e: It held a total of 9 meetings from July 28 to December 8 of the same year and submitted a report dated December 9 approving "February 11" (with opinions of individual members).

sen.e: "Public hearings on National Foundation Day" were held concurrently in Sendai City, Tokyo, Osaka city, and Hiroshima City as the fifth meeting on October 24 of the same year.

sen.j: 質問の趣旨にそわない回答をした者（「建国記念の日を設けることに反対」など）：2.1%（186）
sen.e: Those who responded answers that defeat the purpose of questions: 2.1%(186)

sen.j: もとの元始祭の日：0.1%（11）
sen.e: Former Genshisai (Shinto festival of origins):0.1%(11)
Former Genshisai (Shinto festival of origins):0.1%(11)
Former Genshisai (Shinto festival of origins):0.1%(11)

sen.j: 一説には、名神大社の一つで、『延喜式神名帳』筆頭に記されている、平安京の宮中、宮内省内に「宮内省坐神三座」として二座（2つ）が祀られていた韓神社（からじんじゃ、からかみのやしろ）の祭りの日（2月の春日祭の後の丑の日と11月の新嘗祭の前の丑の日）とも言われている。
sen.e: Some suggest that February 11 is a day of festival of Kara-ninja Shrine or Karakamino-yashiro Shrine, a Myojin-taisha Shrine built within the palace of Heian-Kyo and Kunaisho as two of the "three shrines enshrined in the Department of the Imperial Household" (the day of the Ox (one of the twelve animals of the oriental zodiac) before Kasuga-matsuri Festival and the day of the Ox before Niiname-sai festival.

Some suggest that February 11 is a day of festival of Kara-ninja Shrine or Karakamino-yashiro Shrine, a Myojin-taisha Shrine built within the palace of Heian-Kyo and Kunaisho as two of the "three shrines enshrined in the Department of the Imperial Household" (the day of the Ox (one of the twelve animals of the oriental zodiac) after Kasuga-matsuri Festival and the day of the Ox before Niiname-sai festival).

Some suggest that February 11 is a day of festival of Kara-ninja Shrine or Karakamino-yashiro Shrine, a Myojin-taisha Shrine built within the palace of Heian-Kyo and Kunaisho as two of the "three shrines enshrined in the Department of the Imperial Household" (the day of the Ox (one of the twelve animals of the oriental zodiac) after Kasuga-matsuri Festival and the day of the Ox before Niiname-sai festival).

sen.j: 「建国記念の日」に関する議論が続く中、史学会（歴史学の学会）において、昭和天皇の実弟で同会員でもある三笠宮崇仁親王が理事長の坂本太郎 (歴史学者)に対して反対決議をすべきであると迫った。
sen.e: As controversy over National Foundation Day continues, Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito--a younger brother of Emperor Showa and a member of Shigakukai (The Historical Society of Japan)--urged Taro SAKAMOTO (historian), director of the society, to adopt a resolution on opposition in a meeting of the society..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As controversy over National Foundation Day continues, Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito--a younger brother of the Emperor Showa and a member of Shigakukai (The Historical Society of Japan)--urged Taro SAKAMOTO (historian), director of the society, to adopt a resolution on opposition in a meeting of the society.

As controversy over National Foundation Day continues, Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito--a younger brother of the Emperor Showa and a member of Shigakukai (The Historical Society of Japan)--urged Taro SAKAMOTO (historian), director of the society, to adopt a resolution on opposition in a meeting of the society.

sen.j: しかし史学会は学術団体であり政治的決議をするのは馴染まないとしてこれに応じなかった。
sen.e: However he did not agree saying that doings so is not appropriate for Shigakukai, an academic society.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However he did not agree saying that doings so is not appropriate for Shigakukai, an academic society.
However he did not agree saying that doings so is not appropriate for Shigakukai, an academic society.

sen.j: これに憤慨した三笠宮は総会を退席して「理事長独裁」を批判するとのコメントを出して坂本は世論・マスコミから批判された。
sen.e: Sakamoto was criticized by public opinions and mass media, because Mikasanomiya who had got angry and walked out the general meeting issued a comment to criticize "dictatorship of the director."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Sakamoto was criticized by public opinions and mass media, because Mikasanomiya who had got angry and walked out the general meeting issued a comment to criticize "dictatorship of the director."
Sakamoto was criticized by public opinions and mass media, because Mikasanomiya who had got angry and walked out the general meeting issued a comment to criticize "dictatorship of the director."

sen.j: 一部国粋主義者は三笠宮がこうした決議を行おうとしていた事を知って憤慨して、1959年に「紀元節奉祝建国祭大会」に参加した右翼構成員が宮邸に乱入する事件を起こしている。
sen.e: Some nationalists got angry to know that Mikasanomiya had such intention for the resolution and right-wing group members who participated in "International festival for cerebrating Kigensetsu" caused a scandal by intruding into the imperial palace in 1959.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Some nationalists got angry to know that Mikasanomiya had such intention for the resolution and right-wing group members who participated in "International festival for cerebrating Kigensetsu" caused a scandal by intruding into the imperial palace in 1959.
